abstract.p: Listing of some of most serious terrorist attacks against Americans in Middle East and elsewhere around world (M)

block.p: Some of the most serious terrorist attacks against Americans:
AUG. 7, 1998 -- U.S. Embassies in Kenya and Tanzania are bombed, killing 224 people, 12 of them Americans.
JUNE 25, 1996 -- Truck bomb explodes outside the Khobar Towers housing complex near Dharan, Saudi Arabia, killing 19 U.S. Air Force personnel and injuring more than 500 Americans and Saudis.
Some of the most serious terrorist attacks against Americans:
AUG. 7, 1998 -- U.S. Embassies in Kenya and Tanzania are bombed, killing 224 people, 12 of them Americans.
JUNE 25, 1996 -- Truck bomb explodes outside the Khobar Towers housing complex near Dharan, Saudi Arabia, killing 19 U.S. Air Force personnel and injuring more than 500 Americans and Saudis.
DEC. 21, 1988 -- Pan Am Boeing 747 explodes over Lockerbie, Scotland, on a flight from London to New York, killing 270 people.
SEPT. 5, 1986 -- Hijackers seize Pan Am jumbo jet carrying 358 people at Karachi Airport in Pakistan. Twenty people are killed when security forces storm the plane.
JUNE 14, 1985 -- Shiite gunmen seize a TWA airliner and force it to Beirut, Lebanon. U.S. Navy diver is killed and 39 Americans are held hostage for 17 days.
SEPT. 20, 1984 -- Car bomb at U.S. Embassy annex in east Beirut, Lebanon, kills 16 and injures the ambassador.
OCT. 23, 1983 -- Shiite suicide bomber blows up U.S. Marine barracks in Beirut, killing 241 American servicemen.
APRIL 18, 1983 -- Suicide car-bomber blows up U.S. Embassy in Beirut, killing 17 Americans.
NOV. 4, 1979 -- Islamic students storm U.S. Embassy in Tehran, Iran, holding 52 Americans hostage for 444 days. (Source: The Associated Press)
